trans-unit.source: Generates mappings to SOAP-encoded messages from .NET Framework types or Web service method information.
The <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapReflectionImporter> class provides type mappings to SOAP-encoded message parts, as defined in a Web Services Description Language (WSDL) document.
It is used only when a Web service or client specifies SOAP encoding, as described in Section 5 of the SOAP 1.1 specification.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.SoapReflectionImporter"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.SoapReflectionImporter"></xref> class, specifying a default XML namespace for imported type mappings.
The default XML namespace to use for imported type mappings.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.SoapReflectionImporter"></xref> class, specifying overrides for XML serialization.

A <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributeOverrides"></xref> object that overrides how the <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer"></xref> class serializes mapped types using SOAP encoding.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.SoapReflectionImporter"></xref> class, specifying XML serialization overrides and a default XML namespace.

A <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributeOverrides"></xref> object that overrides how the <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer"></xref> class serializes mapped types using SOAP encoding.
The default XML namespace to use for imported type mappings.
Generates internal type mappings for information that is gathered from a Web service method.
The <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapReflectionImporter.ImportMembersMapping%2A> method is called while initializing a Web service or client, or reflecting a Web service.
You do not need to call it directly.
The following list describes possible values for the `members` parameter:
Web service method input parameters.
Web service method output parameters, plus the return type, if not void, at index zero.
SOAP input headers.
SOAP output headers.
An XML element name produced from the Web service method.
An XML element namespace produced from the Web service method.
An array of .NET Framework code entities that belong to a Web service method.
Internal .NET Framework type mappings to the element parts of a WSDL message definition.
Generates internal type mappings for information that is gathered from a Web service method.
The <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapReflectionImporter.ImportMembersMapping%2A> method is called while initializing a Web service or client, or reflecting a Web service.
You do not need to call it directly.
The following list describes possible values for the `members` parameter:
Web service method input parameters.
Web service method output parameters, plus the return type, if not void, at index zero.
SOAP input headers.
SOAP output headers.
An XML element name produced from the Web service method.
An XML element namespace produced from the Web service method.
An array of .NET Framework code entities that belong to a Web service method.
`true` to indicate that elements that correspond to WSDL message parts should be enclosed in an extra wrapper element in a SOAP message; otherwise, `false`.
`true` to indicate an RPC-style Web service binding; `false` to indicate a document-style Web service binding or a SOAP header.
Internal .NET Framework type mappings to the element parts of a WSDL message definition.
Generates internal type mappings for information that is gathered from a Web service method.
The <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapReflectionImporter.ImportMembersMapping%2A> method is called while initializing a Web service or client, or reflecting a Web service.
You do not need to call it directly.
The following list describes possible values for the `members` parameter:
Web service method input parameters.
Web service method output parameters, plus the return type, if not void, at index zero.
SOAP input headers.
SOAP output headers.
An XML element name produced from the Web service method.
An XML element namespace produced from the Web service method.
An array of .NET Framework code entities that belong to a Web service method.
`true` to indicate that elements that correspond to WSDL message parts should be enclosed in an extra wrapper element in a SOAP message; otherwise, `false`.
`true` to indicate an RPC-style Web service binding; `false` to indicate a document-style Web service binding or a SOAP header.
`true` to indicate that a generated deserializer should check for the expected qualified name of the wrapper element; otherwise, `false`.
This parameter's value is relevant only if the hasWrapperElement parameter's value is `true`.
Internal .NET Framework type mappings to the element parts of a WSDL message definition.
Generates internal type mappings for information that is gathered from a Web service method.
The <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapReflectionImporter.ImportMembersMapping%2A> method is called while initializing a Web service or client, or reflecting a Web service.
You do not need to call it directly.
The following list describes possible values for the `members` parameter:
Web service method input parameters.
Web service method output parameters, plus the return type, if not void, at index zero.
SOAP input headers.
SOAP output headers.
An XML element name produced from the Web service method.
An XML element namespace produced from the Web service method.
An array of .NET Framework code entities that belong to a Web service method.
`true` to indicate that elements that correspond to WSDL message parts should be enclosed in an extra wrapper element in a SOAP message; otherwise, `false`.
`true` to indicate an RPC-style Web service binding; `false` to indicate a document-style Web service binding or a SOAP header.
`true` to indicate that a generated deserializer should check for the expected qualified name of the wrapper element; otherwise, `false`.
This parameter's value is relevant only if the hasWrapperElement parameter's value is `true`.
One of the <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlMappingAccess"></xref> values.
Internal .NET Framework type mappings to the element parts of a WSDL message definition.
Generates a mapping to an XML Schema element for a .NET Framework type.
The XML Schema element is serialized using SOAP encoding.
You do not need to call the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapReflectionImporter.ImportTypeMapping%2A> method directly.
The .NET Framework type for which to generate a type mapping.
Internal .NET Framework mapping of a type to an XML Schema element.
Generates a mapping to an XML Schema element for a .NET Framework type.
The XML Schema element is serialized using SOAP encoding.
You do not need to call the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapReflectionImporter.ImportTypeMapping%2A> method directly.
The .NET Framework type for which to generate a type mapping.
The default XML namespace to use.
Internal .NET Framework mapping of a type to an XML Schema element.
Places mappings for a type in the <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.SoapReflectionImporter"></xref> instance's context for later use when import methods are invoked.
You do not need to call the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapReflectionImporter.IncludeType%2A> method directly.
The .NET Framework type for which to save type mapping information.
Places mappings for derived types in the <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.SoapReflectionImporter"></xref> instance's context for later use when import methods are invoked.

An <xref href="System.Reflection.ICustomAttributeProvider"></xref> reflection object that contains custom attributes that are derived from the <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.SoapIncludeAttribute"></xref> attribute.
